text: Soft peach gold with one finger of white head. Some phenols in the nose, band-aid and cherry skins, tannic oak, vanilla, and tart fruit. Mild tannic bite in the flavor, acidic, cherry skin, band-aid phenolics, and muted fruit. Light bodied and mildly tart.

Refrigerated 75 cl green bottle corked and capped, bottles on March 24, 2016. Clear light orange with small white head. Aroma is tart lemon, mediumbody, lower carbonation, and little lacing. Taste is tart lemon and a little cherries.
Bottle shared at deansos. Hazy copper/orange with a thin white head. Notes of fresh cherries, light lambic funk, fruit tartness, some mineral components. Medium body with light carbonation.

Sampled from bottle at deansos. Courtesy of Maakun. Almost clear golden with white head. Funky fruity wet hay, cherry stone, almond, woody, apricot, strawberry, barnyard, grapes, yeasty. Sweet malts, medium sour, grassy bitter. Medium body, soft carbonation. Milky creamy. Very nice.

2014 bottle shared. Hazy orange pink with fizzy off white head. Quite some tart cherries, raspberries, light lactic, quite some funky yeast, bitter herbs, light mineral. Theres some light sweet malts too, light white pepper. Light sweet and bitter with under medium sourness. Medium bodied with a bit fizzy carbonation.

75cl bottle shared with 7 friends. 
Thin white head. Hazy light amber pour. Sour.

Bottle from facesnorth. Bottled on 10/22/14. Thanks man! It pours a light pinkish orange color with a fizzy off white head. The aroma is nice and tart with cherries, lemon, a good amount of funk and hints of acetic acid. The flavor has tart cherries, a little orange and lemon. Great hay-like and vanilla funk. Pretty full bodied, but dry and sour. Really nice levels of complex acid in this one. Very little acetic. Mostly funk, orange, cherry and lemon. Nice.

Pours a surprising pale rosè red with a lasting white film of bubbles. Noses like 60% RDG 10%saison and 30% light version of LPF.. Seriously this is not so fruity US sour. Still very ale-like if you know what I mean. So not hugely sour but still has some stonefruits and mineral, zesty tartness. Mouthfeel is on point and the aftertaste is light, somewhat tart and drying and slightly cheery/raspberry fruity. I Like. Thank Adam for sending this to Denmark!

First pour was clear, second pour was cloudy. Oh well - small fizzy white head. 
Aroma has a lot of stone fruit, cherries, cherry skin, yeasty spicy goodness, slight lemon juice - and peel, slight marzipan, green apple candy,
apple peel, slight white pepper. 
Taste is dominantly sweet, but definitely has some sweet notes to is as well. 
Medium body, with a very refreshing and sparkly carbonation. 
I was hoping for a more fruity kick, but this really is quite nice.
RBSG 2016 shared at the Grand Tasting. Bottle. Cloudy light pink. Tart cherries, yoghurty and clean, pleasantly sour with light funk. Refreshing.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Bottle 750ml. corked. [ As Bullfrog Le Roar Grrrz Kriek ].[ Bottle 732/1104 ]. Clear medium to light dark orange color with a large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy barnyard, leather, marzipan - almond, cherry. Flavor is moderate to light heavy sweet and light acidic with a long duration, marzipan, cherry, barnyard, tart, funky. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20160624]
Bottle shared at RBSG. The beer is a hazed gold with a pinkish head. Jammy cherries and funk. Reminds me of Cantillon. Sweet and sour cherry skins. Medium body and medium carbonation.

Thanks to Mat for this very brew! Embouteillée le 10/22/2014 et dégustée pour lanniversaire de Marc-André. Je me permets de faire ce review dune bière qui mapparaît clairement past-prime car je souhaite ardemment déguster à nouveau cette bière et ainsi apprécier ce quelle a à offrir à tous les stades de son évolution. Liquide rosé et presque ambré qui offre une tête abondante et persistante. Un myriade de fines bulles émanent du fond de la bouteilles. Tant de légèreté me fait saliver! Arômes caractérisées par un sucre résiduel important qui frôle le glaçage à gâteau. Je sens de lananas, Marc-André ressent de la fraise. Oui, certainement un peu des deux. Un petit gâteau du style muffin ou shortcake qui révèle également une poudre damande pâtissière. Il ne faut pas croire que ce liquide nest que sucre car un fond très funky et lambic-esque ne peut être tenu sous silence. Vraiment, la culture bactérienne responsable de cette fermentation mest présente et très agréable mais bon, le temps a eu raison delle. Le même scénario se produit en bouche. La fine bulle me plaît beaucoup mais la cerise nest pour moi quune simple mention sur une étiquette. Lourde, chargée et sucrée, je refuse de croire que cette bière devait ressembler à cela. Je veux regoûter. Je dois regoûter!

From 750mL, RBSG grand tasting. Great tart and funky lambic aroma, with berry notes and a host of funky qualities. Hazy-cloudy pale amber with thin white head. Medium body with medium-heavy caronbation. Nice cherry profile, sour and tart and funky with tart finish and lingering tart cherry after.

750 ml bottle at Gueuze tasting 2016, Ulfborg. Thanks Bursprak! Unclear golden orange color with off white head. Malty and yeasty aroma, tart fruity, cherries, barnyard, light caramel sweet notes. Sweet and acidic taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Shared bottle. Poured turbid coppery toward ruby with white head. Nose was cherries, yeasty tartness, mild earthy funk. Tasted very tart, with cherry notes, some tartness, and late acidity and yeastiness. Tart finish.

Gylden klar skum hvid 
Krisebær krydderi stald 
Bitter lidt sur modrate 
Oile blød 
@f1

From Bottle @fonefan gueuze tasting Ulfborg, thanks to Bursprak - june 24th 2016. Pours a cludy, orangy golden with a small, white head. Aroma has tart, sour cherries, lots of vinegar and balsamico, spices, floral, hints of cinnamon, marzipan. Taste is sour, spicy, dry, juicy fruity. Really nice! High carbonation and an oily body.

Bottle @ Gueuze tasting 2016 ulfborg. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of fruits, peaches, cherries, light cherry stones/marzipan like notes, light barn, light lactic. Taste is light sours, like christmas spices,, sweet cherries, good funk. Decent

Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Hazy dark golden with a lasting white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, wood, cherries and tart. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate acidic. Dry and moderate acidic finish. 240616

Bottle @ Ulfborg Gueuze Tasting thanks to Bursprak. Pours hazy orange with a slight red hue and a small white head. Aromas of cherries, marzipan, heavy funk, floral, cinnamon. Taste has light cherries, funk, vinegar, perfume, citrus.
Bottle @ Ulfborg gueze tasting. Cloudy dark golden pour with a small frothy head. Notes of tart cherries, marzipan, almonds, oaky, leather and some light balsamico.

750mL c&c at Woodshop 10. Hazy pinkish peach pour with good light pink foam. Nose is seedy and floral with bright white strawberry. Taste is mild chlorine at the front, dry and seltzer mid, late palate gains some Cantillon-like spicy oak and leather. Cantillons style of assertive white peppery Brett in the nose is found in this - impressive. Overall, it is quite soft on the fruit so I would say more strawberry lambic than your typical kriek where cherry can be very assertive.

Bottle @ RBWG 2016. Thanks, Beau, I believe. Sort of an orange colored beer with some white foam. Sort of a cherry pie aroma. A touch of sweet dough/crust and fruits. Theres a nice acidity and tannic cherry skin. Fair bit of lemon zest and some sourness of lemon juice and tart cherries. Could use a bit more actual cherry flavor, but its still a good beer as it is.

750 ml bottle sampled at the RB Best Awards. Thanks to whoever shared this one. Pours a cloudy pinkish gold with a small white head that settles into a ring. Lemon and lime citrus, florals, herbs, and sawdust. The cherries in here are tart but not very pronounced, adding more to the color than the flavor or aroma of this. Light-medium bodied, with moderate to medium carbonation, and a tart, musty mouthfeel. Another good one in the series.

Batch 2, shared in July 2015 at a bottle share with tbub18 -- thanks for sharing! This is similar in a lot of ways to a traditional Belgian lambic, with the Brett characteristics in particular showing that similar barnyard/leather quality. A bit of vinegar flavor, which definitely reminds you this was made in the USA. The cherry flavor tastes like real cherries, and tied everything together. High quality kriek, and one of the best US krieks Ive ever had.

[1/30/16] Bottle sample at the Encomium bottle share, after RateBeer Best awards ceremony at Hyatt Vineyard Creek Hotel in Santa Rosa. Thanks everyone who shared bottles! Cloudy golden. Tart, funky, cherry, oak. Great.

July 18, 2015. Bottle, batch 2, at Quebec tasting, thanks for sharing! 
Hazy dark reddish pink with a small white head. Aroma is tart and juicy cherries, lemon, light funk, almond, a touch of oak, vanilla and plum. Taste is light fruity sweetness with dark berries, tart berry skin notes, cherries, some lemon acidity, light funk, nuts and a light dry finish. Light to medium bodied, a bit oily texture, slight dry finish, average carbonation.
Bottle at RBWG 2016. Nose is acetic and apricot. A touch of soft honey in the finish. A really nice beer
Bottle @ RBWG. Murky peach orange appearance with a white head. Light vinegar, rich oak, vanilla, cherry, and cheese. Fairly tart. Juicy, fine cherries, log barnyard, and funk. Good.

Bottle thanks to mrebeks for sharing. Aroma is pulpy plum and cherries with light brett and yogurt. Taste brings a lot more barnyard/brett to go along with the plums and cherries. Light funkiness and light lemon. Very solid but a little more brett than I like.
750ml bottle from 2014 release. Pours a pinkish red color with a lot of head. Lots of funk and good amount of cherry.

Bottle. Light hazy light pink liquid with medium to big white head. Aroma of cherries, almonds, light grain, mineral, apple skin and lemon. Taste is very light sweet and light to medium sour with notes of cherries, almonds, apple skin and light grain. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Really great. Not that much cherries though.

Pours a bright ruby red color with golden copper edges and a 1.5 finger, pinkish-white head that slowly settles into a thin, lasting ring. Some spotty lacing left behind. 

Musty, funky aroma with strong acetic acid and sour acidity along with oak tannins, lactic funk, juicy sour cherries and subtle toasted oak. Some vanilla bean and red wine character as well along with heavy barnyard funk and horseblanket. The fruit presence stands out as it warms giving off hints of cherry juice, fleshy skins and earthy pits. 

Full body with very dry and acidic sourness countered by sweet, fleshy cherry, lactic funk, musty bugs and barrel. Dry toasted oak along with vinous red wine notes, notably dark grape, sour cherry, current, strawberry and other dark fruits. This is countered by acetic sourness, lactic funk, musty bugs and dry oak. Decent amount of lingering acetic vinegar in the bone dry finish that leaves me drooling for more. Complex yet very well balanced. One of the better American attempts at duplicating a lambic flavor profile.

Courtesy of mrebeks
Bottle: The aroma consists of cherries, baby diapers, funk, and lemon. It pours a cloudy dull orange with a small white head that fades to a thin film outlined by a slightly thicker ring. The flavor starts with moderate sweet cherry and a touch of funk. The finish has mild lemon, oak, and a touch of vanilla. Its light-medium bodied with mild carbonation and a somewhat soft mouthfeel.

Thanks! to Koen. 750 ml. bottle sampled @ ZZT XIII. Reddish amber, little head. Nose is quite acidic, puckering, light nail polish, vinegar, harsh, a bit thin & fizzy. Taste is fizzy puckering vinegar, very basic acidity, sour cherry, lemon acidity, lightly lactic. Very fizzy & puckering. Basic, simple & fun enough. Not on par with a good lambiek & far simpler. Still wondering whether these are spontaneously fermented or what?

Warm hazy amber golden colour, white head. Aroma of cherries, sour notes, yoghurt and krieken. Sour flavour, sickly, cherries, tart. Finish cherry and sickly. Pretty decent American Kriek.(from 75cL bottle @ ZZT XII, Getting Joesd to it Oirschot. Thanks for sharing, Koen!)
Bottle @ ZZT XII. Hazy orange color, average sized white to off-white head. Aroma and taste are both superb: balanced sourness, lovely fruity, red fruit. Very good. Lovely.

Bottle 837 @ ZZT12* (will edit ratings with ZZT13 at a later moment). Peach colour with a small white head. Smells alightly paint, sourish, berries, sour, fruity. Tastes sinaasappel, fruity, sour, fresh, refreshing, nice. Medium body, soft carbo.

Bottle, big thanks to Jack! It pours cloudy deep orange with a thick white head. The nose is funky, earthy, sour cherry, light jam, sherbet, green apple and tangy jam. The taste is crisp, tart, sweet - sweet, earth, ripe cherry, juicy, tangastics, red apple, cherry pie, damp wood and leaves with dry finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Well - rounded and moderate carbonation. Nice one.
750 ml. shared bottle. Pours golden red with a decent off-white head. Aroma of fruit and funk. Taste is tart cherries, funk, and floral. Was expecting more.

750mL bottle, pours a cloudy golden orange with a small white head. Aroma is quite funky and fruity, with sweet and sour cherries, and barnyard funk. Flavour is quite funky, with tart cherries, some acetic notes, and light vinegar. Not like an authentic lambic, but its complex and wonderfully constructed. Excellent stuff.

UPDATED: JUL 21, 2016 Bottle - That very typical euro petroleum nose and only a hint of cherry. Cloudy gold with a decent white head. Syrupy cherry and Gueuze notes. Smells better than it tastes, fruit too muted.  Update - Intense jammy cherry. Cloudy gold with a decent white head.  Big acidic kick and cherries.

Pours perfectly dark strawberry with a creamy link swirling white head, magical! Aroma brings deep cherries laying thick and perfectly over the yeast, maybe even a bit viny. Flavor of cherries and tart pie filling please the mouth with a tame balanced dry ending. Thank you Nate!

Bottle to glass. Pours a beautiful peach rose color with an off white head. Aroma is very nice, floral, berries, sweet. Flavor has an interesting presence, hard for me to describe. Overall a nice beer, but was expecting more given all the hype!
25.4 oz bottle from 10/14. Smelled of cigarettes and cherries. Tart cherries - a nice beer but I liked the berry better.
Really not impressed here. I heard great things but this one just didnt live up to hype. Cherry wasnt really there and the flavor was a bit skunky. Made me wonder if I had a bad bottle.
Lots of tart cherry, with some solid funk. Mouth-watering sourness. Really a marvelous beer.

750ml. Felt that these might be overhyped and I was right. mild sour, brett funk, vinegar. light cherry pulp. Drinkable, but not something i would seek out any more of. I really like my sours with jammy fruit, lots of sweet and a nice puckering sour, this didnt hit any of those.

Bottle at Moriartys. 2014 vintage. Murky orange copper pour. Slim fizzy off-white head. Fragrant deep sour cherry aroma. Nice full body. Head dissipated quickly. Feels like a strong tart lambic but with a twist. Browned sour cherries. Dried orange peels. Prunes. Dates. Pomegranate. Balsamic vinegar.  Interesting. Missing the "dust" that one gets in the best lambics (read Cantilion) but has a pleasant darkness that works quite well. Great stuff!

Bottle, B2 shared by Felipe - thanks man! Pours cloudy hazel with a reddish hue. Medium beige head, dissipates fairly quickly leaving good lacing behind. Aroma is funky, Cantillon like, basement aromas and plenty of tart cherry. Flavor light tart medium plus funky, lots of tart cherry. Medium body. Best of the three we tried, clearly.

ivorywhite head that fades slowly. murky orange colour. aroma is almonds, apricots, funky. taste like aroma, cherries, agrum aftertaste is wood, some tanins. quite dense mouthfeel, medium carbonation. bottle 75cl / bottle #1009 / 2014 / thanks for sharing kermis

UPDATED: JUL 27, 2015 Bottle kindly shared by kermis. Pours hazy red with a little white head. Aroma is lightly funk cherry, a bit of almond. Body is rather sweet with a bit of a sour punch, but all very mellow and well balanced. For a sour (not a lambic(!), this is a very good job keeping the lactic acid under control. The taste is moerately fruity, but they aftertaste is incresible as there is a lot of "frangipane" going on + some tannins. (frangipane is a sweet almond filling known in and arounf France). This is a really nice sour ale.

Bottle shared. Pours very hazy amber with a very short lived white head. Aroma of tart cherry, wood, soft funk, cobwebs and light dank cellar notes. Flavour is light sweet and moderate sour. Medium bodied with light carbonation.
Cherry candi aroma, murky purpleish punch like pour. Flavor of maraschino cherries, too sweet.

Poured from a B2 bottle. Aroma is nice with a good fruitiness with great cherry notes. Light funk nots with a bit of oak. Pours a hazy red with some orange hues and a small, thin white head that recedes to the edges. Flavor is moderately acidic with a really nice sour cherry note. Some medium light oak notes and tannins. Light funk and citrus. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. Overall, a tasty beer but not as funky as I would have expected from the first batch. Great cherry character with good oak notes.

B2 A dark reddish pink with a 1 finger head that fades fast. Huge cork pop. Smells like a light cherry juice with a little acidity, some oak, lemon like sour aroma. Lots of kriek taste but a little bit of salad taste, low acidity but lingering mango, fruit, lime, sour. A little hint of vinegar but not overtly sour. decent mouthfeel but maybe a little thin

Batch #2, Bottle #322. This was rather underwhelming. There are some cherries here, but really more gueuze than kriek going on. Theres a bit of a perfumey note that I wasnt a huge fan of, but that went away as it warmed. What this does have going for it is that its much more of a traditional lambic than any other U.S. made sour Ive tried. It was a good beer with plenty of cheesy funk and light cherry. But given its reputation, hard for this not to be a big letdown.

Batch 1: dark red pour, nose and taste is tart dark cherries, yogurt. One note but tastes great. Creamy mouthfeel.
Batch 2: orange/bright red pour. Nose is herbal tea, taste is berries, herbal tea, spiciness in the finish, paper. Much lighter body than batch one.
4.0 for batch 1, 3.6 for b2

B2 from short notes...

murky bright pink pour. Sharp acrid nose, less fruit than we had hoped. Fresh and canned cherries with that Bathroom urinal cake, cheese and yogurt funk. Taste is the same with a nice Guezy and yeasty tone. A really nice proper kriek 4.0

Poured from bottle to glass. Orange reddish hue with fizzy white head that settled to a ring. Aroma is cherry, lactic, sweat, peppercorn, straw. Mouthfeel is great with a light body and crisp carbonation. Taste is dry with a tart following, and spicy Brett finish. Overall this is a very nice brew.

750 mL bottle poured into a snifter. Bottle #230 of batch 1. Bright pink body. Deep red when theres a lot in the glass. Light pink head that lasts forever. Thick collar and great retention.

Lightly metallic nose. Cherry. Not very juicy aroma, but cherry. Lemon. Dry grass and wood. Cherry taste is a bit sweeter. Quickly dries out. Woody. Lemony tartness. Doesnt quite have the complexity of the base Le Roar. Medium body. Well carbonated. This disappoints just a little bit after drinking the regular Le Roar. Still a great kriek.

UPDATED: JUL 10, 2015 750 ml bottle to taster. Looks good; a mildly hazy orange with white head that steadily dissipates into lacing. Smells and tastes semi-tart and cherry-forward with a medium-bodied mouthfeel. Good beer, but smells better than it tastes.

UPDATE: This was batch 2.
Bottle thanks to Kevin. Pours a cloudy pink orange with small off white head that lasts. The aroma is cherry skin, funk, oak. Thin mouth, jammy, light tartness, cherry skin, very good.

Bottle at the Charlottesville Tasting. Hazy pink/red with off-white head. Aromas of funk, light cherry, floral. Tastes of tart acidic notes, cherry, light vinegar. Medium-light body with a dry finish.

Bottle shared by Travlr at the CVille Foxy Knoxy tasting. Bottle 124/248. Clear dark brown, thin creamy tan head, good retention. Aroma of tart bright cherries, citrus, funk. The taste is tart cherries, pepper, funk. Medium bodied, bright.

Bottle @ CVille Tasting. Big thanks to Gene for the pour! Deep red pour with a small head. Nose of red berry, musty cherry skin. Earthy lemon peel. Nice and zesty. Some cheese, wood. Cherry fruit leather. Lovely stuff. Light and zippy. Vibrant on the palate. Good stuff.
Cherry, musty basement, twigs. Hazy red, thin pink head. Tart cherry, less musty, but subtle sharp cheese finish. Light body, light carbonation. Very nice.

Bottle from the source. Bright clear ruby pink color, pink head with good retention and solid lacing. Beautiful aroma of fresh cherry, raspberry, dusty lemon. Taste is softly sour cherries, tart lemon. Delicious.

Pour is a beautiful dark ruby red, clear, tight pink head and lots of it. Nose has some leathery brett, earthy tones, and a really nice cherry note. Flavor is better than the cantillon, it is leathery brett, earthy, notes of lambic musk, awesome cherry notes, extremely clean and moderately sour in the finish. Dry finish, gentle carbonation, smooth feel.

Bottle... This beer rocks!... Pours murky and rosé with a small, creamy, pinkish head. The aroma is funky and quite fruity, bursting-at-the-seams with raspberries and cherries. Full-bodied with soft carbonation. The flavor is super fruity and bready with a modest measure of funkiness. Tart, yeasty finish. Thanks to ctipping for popping the top off this world-class beer!

Nose is tart cherries mostly with a hint of oakiness. Flavor mostly follows but the cherries dont really burst on the palate and this beer lacks the really uniquely Lambic-y quality that just blasts you in the base Grrrz. Still better than almost every American cherry sour.

Bottle #230, generously shared by Collin. Clear garnet pour with a fleeting white head. Nice sour cherry and funk aromas. Tart with sour cherry highlights. Mild barnyard and funk notes with barrel undercurrents. Good body and mouthfeel.
Bottle - Pours ruby red. Cherries, oak, lemon zest, tart, and sour nose. Tart, sour, and slight hint of cherries. Nose is solid, taste dies off too quickly.

Bottle. Bright red pour with very nice pink head. Aroma is loaded with cherries and other berries, some leaves and cherry pie spices. Taste is bright cherries, some leaves. Acidity is very intense and well done, citric and lactic. An acidity this high is pretty uncommon for an American sour which isnt acetic. Maybe a little too sour for my liking, but very well done.

[ Keg ][ ½ of 12oz ][ @Hunger n Thirst ][ $7 ][ Snifter ][ 9.25.14 ]Hazy pink amber, thin large-bubbled white ring. Moderately sour, lightly vinous nose, earthy with hay and light rubber. Really fresh, bright front palate, lightly sticky, moderately sour cherry. Wet wood and hay mid, very dank, very earthy before the slick, lightly sugary finish, more cherry in tongue-curled sourness, faint cobweb. Not as complex a lambic as Grrrz and Druiven, #3 of the 5 that exist so far.

bottle shared by tom10101, huge thanks brah! pours unclear bright red-pink with a very nice pink head demonstrating very good retention and lacing. fruity cherries and raspberries, musty and funky - lots of funk in fact, breadiness/wheatiness, some leafy grassy notes, tea leaves, light mint, light and welcoming acidity - citric and lactic mostly - no disturbing acetic, subtle floral notes, touch of cinnamon and other spices. average to light carbonation - could be brighter, light body - oily, pleasantly tart-citric and herbal-grassy finish. easily the best american kriek interpretation - more belgian than some belgian krieks. excellent!

Bottle 750ml.
Pours pink/purple with low pink head. Intense lacing. Aroma is of cherries, berries, sourness. Taste is of cherries, sourness, acidity, some "tannins", cheese. Palate: Mouth-puckering. Light-medium body, low-medium carbonation. Overall: Very good. Im pretty sure I would have think belgian in a blind tasting. This one aint fooling around. Its the stuff.

Bottle shared by tom10101, thanks a lot Tom! Pours a dark red with a pinkish head that leaves some lacing. Nose is of cherries of course but also offers some candy and funk. Taste is really acidic but not acetic (this doesnt feel like an american sour at all in that aspect). Flavors are just fruity and loaded with cherries. Body is light, carbonation moderate and like I said acidity level is pretty high but it remains drinkable. Overall a nice one, not sure why my score is so low compared to my tasting colleagues but Ill stand by that for now.

UPDATED: SEP 22, 2014 Bottle (750 ml). From Frank, thanks! Beautiful appearance, almost clear bright reddish pink with a small pinkish head and little lacing. Aroma is of light barnyard, bright cherries, hay, funk, leafy notes, light sulfur (but not in a bad way)... all superbly integrated. Taste is also wonderful and really "Belgian" with a kind of funk very similar to Drie Fonteinen as well as bright cherries (but they dont take all the place), hay, leafy notes, hints of sweetness and light hints of sulfur. Medium body. Moderate/medium carbonation. Superb Kriek and without a double the best american fruited sour Ive ever had. True to style. Can compete against any Belgian Kriek. The balance is simply amazing. Incredibly tasty. My favorite Kriek ever along De Cam Oude Kriek.

Bottle shared at tasting. Beautiful bright pink red pour with lacy, creamy pink foam. Aroma is fantastic, intense fleshy cherry pulp and skins, winey notes, black and sour cherries, citrusy and lactic aromas. Taste is tart, nice sharp tartness with explosive sweet cherry flavor. This is really, really nice beer, it combines several of the best elements of classic Belgian gueuze, leafy, minty oude gueuze notes with an bright and fresh american twist. It is the most authentic kriek Ive tasted from the USA, and just simply a sublime beer.

UPDATED: DEC 21, 2014 [5683-20130817] Bottle. Dry yeast cherry skin aroma. Hazy, bright red body with a quick foamy white head. Dry sour cherry juice flavour. Medium body. Deliciously sour and drinkable. (8/4/9/4/17) 4.2
(@ Campground Brewdown 2013, Millmont, PA)
Overheard: "What I should have said was nothing. What I did say was, Youd be surprised." -- punch line

[6652B-20140816] Bottle. Cherry sour yeast aroma. Hazy, pink red body with a medium-lasting foamy light pink head. Soured cherry yeast flavour. Medium body is fairly sour. Great. (8/4/8/4/17) 4.1
(@ Campground Brewdown 2014, Millmont, PA)
Overheard: "Is there some reason the ground is on fire?"
Reddish pour, mostly white head. Great kriek. Yeasty, sour, tart cherry, unripe nectarine, some good funk. Great.

This one poured a dark but bright red with a pinkish head. Aroma was of cherry pez, Brett, light barn character. Flavor was subdued acidity, light cjeessy funk, and cherry pits and bretty PES character. Still pretty balanced, light cinnamon and dark fruits too
Bottle at Bobbys tasting. Rating 8,000. Pours reddish pink head. Nose/taste of hay, cherry, oak, tart cherry acid, barnyard and straw. Medium body.
Bottle. Ruby red pour with pink head. Huge tart cherry aromas. Well done cherry tartness, wild tones. Very nice cherry sour.
750ml corked and caged bottle. Reddish hue to the pour. The body is lgiht and effervescent, cherries and sour funk in the flavor but very lgiht and refreshing.

Bottle from Grrrz release. Pours a ruby reddish color with a white head. Aroma is of slight rubber/band-aid and cherry, earthy notes. Taste is sour and a cherry flavor really comes through. My least favorite of the bunch.
UPDATED: AUG 3, 2014 Bottle shared at Arts. Poured light hazy dark red with light pink head. Aroma of citric acid. Light carb med bod. Very drying sour fruit taste.
75cl, no mention of ABV, new exclusive American brew Anno 2013, thx alot to Geoff!, very complex sour Kriek, sour/fruity and slightly woody, balanced, cloudy, good head, very good brew

Thanks Frank. Medium raspberry-red colored body, thin pinkish head, traces of lacing. Musty oak, cherry pie, floral honey, raspberry, lactic notes. Medium bodied, starting to carbonate up nicely, moderate acidity, slight puckering finish. Really looking forward to the formal release of this as it should have developed further in the bottle.

Served on-tap at the Bainbridge Street Barrel House 1st Anniversary Party as well as from a bottle a few months back.


A - Pours ruby red with a fluffy one and a half finger tall pink head, dissipating down to a light film around the edges of the glass, leaving spotty trails of lace down the sides of the glass. Really nice looking beer.


S - Smells of tart sour cherries, damp basement must, bit of barnyard funk, woody oak, earthy minerals and some nice sourness. You can really pick out the individual parts making this one up.


T - Starts off just like the nose. Lots of tart sour cherries up front quickly giving way to the musty funk blend from the yeast and a quick hit of tart sourness. Hints of oak, some citric fruit and the earthy minerals help round it all out. Finish is tart with a decent amount of dryness, lingering after each sip.


M - Medium body with moderate carbonation. Tart, dry feel with a good amount of fruit throughout.


O - An excellent Kriek. You can really taste the Cantillon must and Drie Fonteinen funk from the yeast and they combine really well with the cherries. Last time I had it the cherries were losing out to the stronger yeast, I am glad to see some extra time has evened things out. Cant wait to get my hands on some bottles of this one, its going to age with the best of them.

UPDATED: AUG 22, 2014 2014-08-16. Murky red-pink body with a modest pink head.  Aroma is lightly funky, musty, muted cherry character. Flavour is bone dry, fairly acidic and mouth puckering bite but has enough fruit character to keep it reasonable. Average bodied palate, soft effervescent carbonation. Zippy and tasty but not particularly subtle. 7/4/8/3/15-16 Bottle at Campground Brewdown

2013-08-17. Bright red pink body tiny pink head. Aroma is lightly fruity and quite funky with notes of cherry fruit. 7++ Flavour is quite tart and acidic, muted fruity cherry character. Average bodied palate, good carbonation. Yumm! Not super complex but zippy tasty stuff. 7/4/8/3/17 Bottle, Campground Brewdown.
Bottle. Pours red/pink with a thin white head. Dry and funky, with tart and sour cherry, hints of oak, and nice dry and tart finish. Pretty damn good. Very drinkable, too.

Sampled this at Campground Brewdown 2. Pours a hazed ruby red with a thin pink head. Big chewy cherries and soft acid on the nose. Sweet and tangy, big chewy cherries. Tangy and tannic, lovely funk. Long and funky finish.
Bottle. Beautiful ruby body, light pink head. Nose is gorgeous cherries, wood, lemon pits, grapefruit pith. Flavor is cherry & wood, lemon, grapefruit rind, beautiful tartness. Wonderful stuff.

Bottle courtesy of Frank, huge thanks. Pours a bright, vibrant red body with light white lacing. Aroma is super tart cherries, zippy funk and sour fruits. Mouthfeel is perfectly balanced with notes of sour candy, cherries, funk, basement and tart candy. Absolutely incredible.

Thanks for bringing this one Mike

unlabeled pre release bottle shared at our 7/27/13 tasting

Once poured, this was one of the best looking beers i have seen. I will second Josh in that it reminded me of being a kid drinking fruit punch, only it packed more punch.. da da da

No head or lacing to be found. Smell of under ripe cherry skin. The smell was underwhelming, and didnt do the appearance or taste any justice.

Flavor of ripe sweet cherries with a mild acidity. Bright citrus with a bit of lemony funk. Extremely well balanced flavor of fruit and sourness. I want a bottle to age for a few yrs to see how the funk developes.

Overall, really happy to have tried this pre bottle release. Probably the youngest kriek I have had to date and it exceeded my expectations of what an american brewery making belgian lambic/krieks can do

Bottle with Bill/Frank, shared by Frank via Nate. Thanks brahs. Keg conditioned. Pours hazy cranberry with light head, small amt of lacing. Aromas are musk, barn, cherry, perfume, taste is lambic kriek, sour cherry, raspberry, oak, and tart funkiness. The flavor is much more impressive then aroma but it is still relatively young and not bottle conditioned, those should be retarded in a month or two. All things considered, this is excellent.
